content.title: 1. SCOPE
content.description: This Software Development Plan (SDP) complies with DI-IPSC-81427B and provides the acquirer insight into, and a tool for monitoring, the processes to be followed for software development, the methods to be used, the approach to be followed for each activity, and project schedules, organization, and resources for the Ignition AI Project Dashboard.

children.title: 1.1 Identification
children.description:
System/Subsystem: Ignition AI Project Dashboard
CSCI Name: Ignition Core Application
Contract Number: [To be assigned]
Contractor: [Organization Name]
Contract Line Item Number (CLIN): [To be assigned]
DI-IPSC-81427B Data Item Description: Software Development Plan

children.title: 1.2 System Overview
children.description: The Ignition AI Project Dashboard is a comprehensive web-based tool designed to accelerate software development project initiation by providing structured documentation, methodology alignment, and AI-powered capabilities. The system serves as a bootstrapping platform for software development projects, ensuring compliance with industry standards including CMMI, ISO 27001, SOC 2, HIPAA, and FDA regulations.

children.title: 1.3 Document Overview
children.description: This SDP describes the software development approach, processes, methods, tools, and resources required for the development of the Ignition system. It addresses all phases of the software development lifecycle from requirements analysis through deployment and maintenance. The plan serves as the primary management document for controlling and monitoring the software development effort.

content.title: 2. REFERENCED DOCUMENTS
content.description:
This SDP references and complies with the following documents:
- DI-IPSC-81427B, Software Development Plan Data Item Description
- CMMI for Development, Version 2.0
- ISO/IEC 27001:2022, Information Security Management
- SOC 2 Type II Compliance Framework
- HIPAA Security Rule (45 CFR Part 164)
- FDA 21 CFR Part 11, Electronic Records and Electronic Signatures
- Federal Rules of Evidence 901 & 902 (Authentication Requirements)

content.title: 3. ENGINEERING ENVIRONMENT
content.description: This section describes the development environment, standards, and tools that will be used for the development of the Ignition AI Project Dashboard.

children.title: 3.1 Development Environment
children.description:
Development Environment: Modern web development stack
- Operating System: Windows 10/11, macOS, or Linux
- Web Browser: Chrome 120+, Firefox 120+, Safari 17+, Edge 120+
- Code Editor: Visual Studio Code with TypeScript and React extensions
- Runtime: Node.js 18+ for development server
- Version Control: Git with GitHub integration
- Package Management: NPM with importmap for dependency management

children.title: 3.2 Development Standards
children.description:
Coding Standards:
- TypeScript strict mode enabled
- ESLint configuration for code quality
- Prettier for code formatting
- React functional components with hooks
- Modular architecture with clear separation of concerns

Documentation Standards:
- JSDoc comments for all public functions
- README files for each major component
- Inline comments for complex business logic

children.title: 3.3 Development Tools
children.description:
Primary Development Tools:
- React 18+ for user interface development
- TypeScript 5+ for type-safe JavaScript
- Framer Motion for animations and transitions
- Chart.js for data visualization
- D3.js for advanced graphics
- Lucide React for iconography

External Service Integration:
- Google Gemini API for AI-powered content generation
- GitHub REST API for repository integration
- Browser localStorage for data persistence

content.title: 4. Development Environment
content.description: The development and testing for Ignition will be conducted using standard web development tools and environments.

children.title: 4.1 Software Development Environment
children.description: The development environment will consist of a modern JavaScript runtime (Node.js), a code editor with TypeScript and React support, and a local web server (e.g., `npx serve`). Dependencies are managed via the `importmap` in `index.html`.

children.title: 4.2 Test Environment
children.description: Testing will be performed manually in the latest versions of major web browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari). The test environment is identical to the development and production environments, as the application is a static site.

content.title: 8. NOTES
content.description: This section provides additional information, assumptions, constraints, and special considerations for the Ignition AI Project Dashboard development.

children.title: 8.1 Assumptions
children.description:
Project Assumptions:

Technical Assumptions:
- Google Gemini API will remain stable and accessible throughout development
- Modern web browsers will continue to support required JavaScript features
- GitHub API will maintain current functionality and rate limits
- Local storage will remain the primary data persistence mechanism

Organizational Assumptions:
- Single developer will have sufficient expertise across all required technologies
- Stakeholders will provide timely feedback on deliverables and requirements
- AI-powered automation will achieve target accuracy and performance metrics
- Meta-compliance approach will be accepted by regulatory and audit bodies

Environmental Assumptions:
- Development environment will remain stable and accessible
- Internet connectivity will be reliable for AI service integration
- Cloud infrastructure will provide required scalability and reliability
- Security and compliance requirements will not change significantly during development

children.title: 8.2 Constraints
children.description:
Project Constraints:

Technical Constraints:
- Application must run entirely in web browser without server-side dependencies
- Data must be stored locally to ensure privacy and security
- AI services must be accessed through official APIs only
- Application must be compatible with major web browsers and operating systems

Resource Constraints:
- Single developer resource for all development activities
- Limited budget for external services and infrastructure
- Development timeline constrained by AI service rate limits
- Testing resources limited to manual testing and automated quality gates

Regulatory Constraints:
- Must comply with multiple regulatory standards simultaneously
- Audit trails must meet Federal Rules of Evidence requirements
- Security controls must satisfy enterprise-grade requirements
- Documentation must be suitable for regulatory inspection and validation

Operational Constraints:
- Application must be deployable in various environments (local, cloud, enterprise)
- Must support offline operation when AI services are unavailable
- Performance must remain acceptable as project data grows
- User interface must be intuitive without extensive training requirements

children.title: 8.3 Special Considerations
children.description:
Special Considerations and Unique Aspects:

Meta-Compliance Architecture:
- The Ignition tool will manage its own development process, creating a self-referential compliance system
- Tool capabilities must be documented within the tool itself
- Process improvements identified by the tool must be implementable within the tool
- Audit trails generated by the tool must be auditable by the tool

AI Integration Considerations:
- AI-generated content must be validated and verified before use in compliance contexts
- AI service dependencies must have fallback mechanisms for critical functions
- AI recommendations must be traceable and auditable
- Human oversight must be maintained for all AI-assisted decisions

Scalability and Evolution:
- Architecture must support future expansion to manage multiple projects
- Process asset framework must evolve and improve over time
- Tool must be extensible to support additional compliance standards
- Knowledge base must grow and improve through usage patterns

Security and Privacy:
- All data processing must occur locally to protect sensitive information
- API keys and credentials must be stored securely
- Audit trails must maintain integrity and non-repudiation
- Access controls must be implementable for enterprise deployments

children.title: 8.4 Future Enhancements
children.description:
Planned Future Enhancements:

Organizational Intelligence:
- Advanced analytics for organizational process maturity assessment
- Predictive modeling for project success and risk factors
- Automated process optimization based on historical performance data
- Cross-project learning and knowledge transfer capabilities

Advanced Automation:
- Automated test case execution and validation
- Real-time code quality assessment and improvement suggestions
- Automated documentation generation from code and requirements
- Intelligent resource allocation and capacity planning

Extended Compliance Support:
- Additional regulatory frameworks (GDPR, CCPA, NIST, etc.)
- Industry-specific compliance standards (automotive, aerospace, medical devices)
- International standards support (ISO 9001, ISO 14001, etc.)
- Custom compliance framework definition and validation

Enterprise Features:
- Multi-user collaboration and role-based access control
- Enterprise authentication and authorization integration
- Advanced reporting and dashboard customization
- Integration with enterprise project management and development tools

content.title: 4. MANAGEMENT
content.description: This section describes the management approach, organization, and processes for the Ignition AI Project Dashboard development effort.

children.title: 4.1 Organization
children.description:
Project Organization:
- Project Lead: Responsible for overall project direction, stakeholder communication, and technical decisions
- Development Team: Single developer with full-stack capabilities
- Quality Assurance: Integrated into development process with automated quality gates
- Configuration Management: Automated through Git/GitHub integration

Reporting Structure:
- Daily progress tracked through Ignition Project Health Dashboard
- Weekly status reports generated automatically from project metrics
- Milestone reviews conducted at major feature completions

children.title: 4.2 Schedule Management
children.description:
Schedule Management Approach:
- Agile development methodology with 2-week iterations
- Automated milestone tracking through Ignition Analytics Dashboard
- AI-powered schedule optimization based on development velocity
- Real-time progress monitoring with automated alerts for schedule deviations

Automated Schedule Tools:
- Development Activity Intelligence Service tracks commit frequency and velocity
- Intelligent Workflow Orchestrator provides schedule recommendations
- Quality gates automatically block releases until criteria are met
- Process Asset Framework suggests schedule optimizations based on historical data

children.title: 4.3 Resources
children.description:
Resource Allocation:
- Development Environment: Modern web development stack (Node.js, TypeScript, React)
- AI Services: Google Gemini API for intelligent content generation and analysis
- Infrastructure: GitHub for version control, GitHub Actions for CI/CD
- Quality Tools: Automated quality assurance service with configurable validation rules

Resource Management Automation:
- Automated dependency management through package.json and npm
- Resource utilization tracking through Development Activity Intelligence
- Capacity planning assisted by AI analysis of development patterns
- Cost optimization through automated cloud resource management

children.title: 4.4 Configuration Management
children.description:
Configuration Management is automated through the Ignition Configuration Management Service:

Automated CM Processes:
- Version control through Git with automated branching strategies
- Configuration Item identification and tracking via CI Scanner
- Automated baseline establishment at major milestones
- Change control through GitHub pull request workflows
- Automated audit trails for all configuration changes

CM Tools Integration:
- GitHub integration for distributed version control
- Automated CI/CD pipelines for build and deployment
- Configuration Item dependency tracking and impact analysis
- Automated compliance checking against CM policies

Refer to Configuration Management Plan for detailed procedures.

children.title: 4.5 Quality Assurance
children.description:
Quality Assurance is implemented through the Ignition Quality Assurance Service:

Automated QA Processes:
- Real-time quality gates with configurable thresholds (Requirements: 85%, Documentation: 80%, Risk Management: 90%)
- Automated validation of requirements completeness and traceability
- Continuous compliance checking against multiple standards (ISO 27001, SOC 2, HIPAA, FDA CFR)
- AI-powered quality assessment and improvement recommendations

QA Automation Features:
- Custom validation rules engine for project-specific quality criteria
- Automated quality reporting and dashboard visualization
- Integration with development workflow for continuous quality monitoring
- Automated quality metrics collection and trend analysis

Refer to Quality Assurance procedures for detailed validation criteria.

children.title: 4.6 Corrective Action
children.description:
Corrective Action Process:

Automated Issue Detection:
- Quality Assurance Service automatically identifies non-conformances
- Development Activity Intelligence detects process violations
- Compliance Service flags regulatory non-compliance issues
- AI-powered root cause analysis for recurring problems

Corrective Action Workflow:
1. Automated issue identification and categorization
2. AI-generated corrective action recommendations
3. Automated assignment to responsible parties
4. Progress tracking through Ignition dashboard
5. Automated verification of corrective action effectiveness

Process Improvement:
- Lessons learned captured in Process Asset Framework
- Automated process optimization recommendations
- Continuous improvement through AI analysis of development patterns

children.title: 4.7 Reviews and Audits
children.description:
Review and Audit Process:

Automated Review Processes:
- Continuous peer review through GitHub pull request workflows
- Automated code quality reviews using static analysis tools
- AI-powered document review and improvement suggestions
- Automated compliance audits against regulatory standards

Review Schedule:
- Daily: Automated quality gate checks
- Weekly: AI-generated project health reports
- Monthly: Comprehensive compliance audit reports
- Quarterly: Process effectiveness reviews with improvement recommendations

Audit Trail Automation:
- Complete audit logging of all development activities
- Automated evidence collection for compliance audits
- Digital signature and hash verification for audit integrity
- Automated audit report generation with FRE 901/902 compliance

children.title: 4.8 Risk Management
children.description:
Risk Management is automated through the Ignition Risk Management Service:

Automated Risk Processes:
- AI-powered risk identification from project data analysis
- Automated risk assessment and prioritization
- Real-time risk monitoring and alert generation
- Automated mitigation strategy recommendations

Key Project Risks and Automated Mitigations:
1. API Dependencies (Gemini, GitHub): Automated service encapsulation and fallback mechanisms
2. Data Loss: Automated backup and export capabilities with localStorage redundancy
3. Security Vulnerabilities: Automated security scanning and compliance validation
4. Quality Degradation: Continuous quality monitoring with automated quality gates

Risk Monitoring Automation:
- Development Activity Intelligence tracks risk indicators
- Automated risk trend analysis and reporting
- Integration with quality gates to prevent risk materialization
- AI-powered predictive risk analysis based on development patterns

content.title: 1. Introduction
content.description: This document defines the Configuration Management (CM) plan for the Ignition project. It describes the processes and procedures for identifying, controlling, and tracking software and documentation items, with emphasis on automated CM processes provided by the Ignition tool.

content.title: 2. CM Organization & Responsibilities
content.description:
CM Organization:
- Lead Developer: Overall CM responsibility and policy definition

- AI Assistant: Intelligent CM guidance and optimization recommendations

Automated CM Responsibilities:

- Real-time change impact analysis and dependency tracking

Integration Capabilities:

- Documentation (SDP, SRS, CM Plan, QA procedures, process assets)
- Configuration Files (package.json, deployment manifests, CI/CD workflows)
- Build and Deployment Artifacts (Docker images, Kubernetes manifests)

Automated CI Management:
- Unique identification assignment and version control integration
- Dependency relationship mapping and impact analysis
- Automated CI status tracking and reporting
- Integration with quality gates for CI validation

Change Validation:

content.title: 5. Automated Audit and Evidence Collection
content.description:
Audit Automation Capabilities:

Automated Audit Features:
- Continuous automated audit trail generation and maintenance
- Real-time audit evidence collection and validation
- Automated audit report generation with FRE 901/902 compliance
- AI-powered audit finding analysis and corrective action recommendations

Audit Evidence Management:
- Digital signature and hash verification for audit integrity
- Automated chain of custody maintenance for audit artifacts
- Real-time audit trail validation and compliance checking
- Integration with compliance systems for regulatory audit support

Audit Reporting:
- Automated generation of comprehensive audit reports
- Real-time audit dashboard with compliance metrics and status
- Automated audit notification and stakeholder communication
- Integration with corrective action systems for audit finding resolution

content.title: 6. Quality Metrics and Continuous Improvement
content.description:
Quality Metrics Automation:

Automated Quality Metrics:
- Real-time quality score calculation and trending
- Automated quality gate pass/fail tracking and analysis
- Quality improvement trend analysis and predictive modeling
- Integration with development activity intelligence for quality correlation

Continuous Improvement:
- Automated identification of quality improvement opportunities
- AI-powered quality process optimization recommendations
- Integration with Process Asset Framework for quality knowledge management
- Automated quality lessons learned capture and dissemination

Quality Dashboard:
- Real-time quality metrics visualization and reporting
- Quality trend analysis and predictive quality forecasting
- Automated quality alert and notification systems
- Integration with project management systems for quality-driven decision making

content.title: 1. Scope
content.description: This section provides the scope of the Software Requirements Specification for the Ignition AI Project Dashboard Computer Software Configuration Item (CSCI) in accordance with DI-IPSC-81433A.

children.title: 1.1 Identification
children.description:
System Identification:

System Name: Ignition AI Project Dashboard
CSCI Name: Ignition AI Project Dashboard CSCI
Identification Number: IGN-CSCI-001
Version: 1.0
Release: Initial Release
Abbreviation: Ignition

Applicable Documents:
- Software Development Plan (SDP): DI-IPSC-81427B
- Interface Requirements Specification (IRS): DI-IPSC-81434A
- Configuration Management Plan
- Quality Assurance Procedures

This CSCI implements a comprehensive AI-powered project management and compliance validation system designed to support software development organizations in achieving and maintaining regulatory compliance while optimizing development processes.

children.title: 1.2 System Overview
children.description:
System Purpose and Nature:

The Ignition AI Project Dashboard is a web-based Computer Software Configuration Item designed to provide comprehensive project management, compliance validation, and process optimization capabilities for software development organizations.

General Nature:
- Client-side web application with AI-powered automation
- Multi-standard compliance validation system
- Automated configuration management and quality assurance
- Real-time project health monitoring and analytics
- Process asset framework for organizational knowledge management

Development History:
- Initial development: 2024-2025
- Target deployment: Cloud-native with local data storage
- Maintenance approach: Continuous integration with automated quality gates

Stakeholders:
- Project Sponsor: Development Organization
- Acquirer: Software Development Teams
- Users: Project Managers, Developers, QA Professionals, Compliance Officers
- Developer: Single Full-Stack Developer
- Support Agency: Internal Development Team

Operating Sites:
- Primary: Cloud deployment (GitHub Pages, Netlify, AWS S3)
- Secondary: Local development environments
- Future: Enterprise on-premises deployments

children.title: 1.3 Document Overview
children.description:
Document Purpose and Contents:

This Software Requirements Specification (SRS) defines the complete functional and non-functional requirements for the Ignition AI Project Dashboard CSCI in accordance with DI-IPSC-81433A standards.

Document Contents:
- Section 1: Scope and identification of the CSCI
- Section 2: Referenced documents and standards
- Section 3: Detailed CSCI requirements (functional and non-functional)
- Section 4: Qualification provisions and testing methods
- Section 5: Requirements traceability matrix
- Section 6: Notes, glossary, and appendices

Security and Privacy Considerations:
- All sensitive data remains on client-side (local browser storage)
- API keys and credentials stored securely in browser
- No transmission of proprietary information to external services
- Compliance with HIPAA, SOC 2, and ISO 27001 privacy requirements
- Audit trails meet Federal Rules of Evidence 901/902 standards

Document Maintenance:
- Version control through Git integration
- Automated change tracking and impact analysis
- Real-time requirements validation and compliance checking
- AI-powered requirements quality assessment and improvement

content.title: 2. Referenced Documents
content.description: This section lists all documents referenced in this Software Requirements Specification, including standards, specifications, and external documentation.

children.title: 2.1 Government Documents
children.description:
Government Standards and Specifications:

- DI-IPSC-81427B: Software Development Plan (SDP)
- DI-IPSC-81433A: Software Requirements Specification (SRS)
- DI-IPSC-81434A: Interface Requirements Specification (IRS)
- Federal Rules of Evidence 901: Authentication Requirements
- Federal Rules of Evidence 902: Self-Authentication
- HIPAA Security Rule (45 CFR Part 164): Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act
- FDA 21 CFR Part 11: Electronic Records; Electronic Signatures

These documents are available through normal Government stocking activities or from the issuing agencies.

children.title: 2.2 Non-Government Documents
children.description:
Industry Standards and Specifications:

- IEEE Std 830-1998: IEEE Recommended Practice for Software Requirements Specifications
- ISO/IEC 27001:2022: Information Security Management Systems
- SOC 2 Type II: Service Organization Control 2 Type II Compliance Framework
- CMMI for Development, Version 2.0: Capability Maturity Model Integration

Technical Documentation:
- Google Gemini API Documentation (https://ai.google.dev/docs)
- GitHub API Documentation (https://docs.github.com/en/rest)
- React 18+ Documentation (https://react.dev/)
- TypeScript Language Specification (https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/)
- Vite Build Tool Documentation (https://vitejs.dev/guide/)

These documents are available from their respective publishers or through standard industry channels.

content.title: 3. Requirements
content.description: This section provides an overview of the Ignition AI Project Dashboard system, including its context, functions, user characteristics, constraints, and dependencies.

children.title: 2.1 Product Perspective
children.description:
System Context and Relationships:

System Architecture:
- Client-side web application built with React and TypeScript
- Local browser storage for data persistence and privacy
- Integration with external AI services for intelligent assistance
- Integration with version control systems for configuration management

System Interfaces:
- User Interface: Modern web-based dashboard with responsive design
- AI Service Interface: Google Gemini API for content generation and analysis
- Version Control Interface: GitHub API for repository management and CI/CD
- File System Interface: Local browser storage and export/import capabilities

Operating Environment:
- Client Platform: Modern web browsers (Chrome 120+, Firefox 120+, Safari 17+, Edge 120+)
- Server Platform: Static hosting (GitHub Pages, Netlify, AWS S3, etc.)
- Network Requirements: Internet connectivity for AI services and version control
- Storage Requirements: Local browser storage with export/backup capabilities

System Positioning:
- Standalone project management and compliance tool
- Meta-compliance system managing its own development process
- Organizational knowledge base and process improvement platform
- Integration hub for development tools and compliance frameworks

children.title: 2.2 Product Functions
children.description:
Major System Functions:

1. Project Documentation Management:
   - Create, edit, and manage project documents (SDP, SRS, CM Plan, etc.)
   - AI-powered content generation and improvement
   - Real-time document validation and quality assessment
   - Automated document formatting and structure compliance

2. Requirements Management:
   - Requirements capture, analysis, and validation
   - Automated requirements traceability and impact analysis
   - AI-powered requirements generation and improvement
   - Real-time requirements quality assessment

3. Configuration Management:
   - Automated configuration item identification and tracking
   - Version control integration and change management
   - Baseline establishment and configuration auditing
   - Dependency analysis and impact assessment

4. Quality Assurance:
   - Automated quality gates with configurable thresholds
   - Multi-standard compliance validation and reporting
   - Continuous quality monitoring and improvement
   - AI-powered quality assessment and recommendations

5. Process Asset Management:
   - Organizational knowledge capture and reuse
   - AI-powered process asset generation and refinement
   - Process improvement recommendations and optimization
   - Hybrid wiki and structured data management

6. Analytics and Reporting:
   - Real-time project health monitoring and dashboards
   - Automated compliance reporting and audit trails
   - Predictive analytics and risk assessment
   - Performance metrics and trend analysis

children.title: 2.3 User Characteristics
children.description:
User Profiles and Characteristics:

Primary Users - Software Development Professionals:
- Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
- Experience: 3+ years in software development and project management
- Technical Skills: Proficient in software development tools and methodologies
- Domain Knowledge: Familiar with CMMI, quality assurance, and compliance frameworks
- Usage Pattern: Daily use for project management and documentation tasks

Secondary Users - Quality Assurance and Compliance Professionals:
- Education: Bachelor's degree in relevant field or equivalent experience
- Experience: 2+ years in quality assurance, compliance, or audit functions
- Technical Skills: Understanding of quality frameworks and compliance standards
- Domain Knowledge: Expert in regulatory requirements and audit processes
- Usage Pattern: Regular use for compliance validation and audit preparation

Tertiary Users - Project Managers and Stakeholders:
- Education: Bachelor's degree in Business, Management, or related field
- Experience: 2+ years in project management or organizational leadership
- Technical Skills: Basic understanding of software development processes
- Domain Knowledge: Familiar with project management and organizational processes
- Usage Pattern: Periodic use for project oversight and reporting

User Accessibility Requirements:
- Web accessibility compliance (WCAG 2.1 AA)
- Keyboard navigation support
- Screen reader compatibility
- Responsive design for various devices and screen sizes

children.title: 2.4 Constraints
children.description:
System Constraints and Limitations:

Technical Constraints:
- Client-side only architecture (no server-side processing)
- Browser storage limitations for data persistence
- Dependency on external AI services for intelligent features
- Network connectivity required for AI and version control integration
- JavaScript execution environment limitations

Regulatory Constraints:
- Compliance with multiple regulatory frameworks simultaneously
- Audit trail requirements meeting Federal Rules of Evidence standards
- Data privacy and security requirements (HIPAA, GDPR considerations)
- Electronic signature and authentication requirements (FDA CFR Part 11)

Operational Constraints:
- Single-user operation (no multi-user collaboration in initial version)
- Local data storage with manual backup and synchronization
- Limited offline functionality when AI services are unavailable
- Browser compatibility requirements for enterprise environments

Resource Constraints:
- Development by single developer with full-stack responsibilities
- Limited budget for external services and infrastructure
- Time constraints for rapid development and deployment
- API rate limits for external service integration

Security Constraints:
- All sensitive data must remain on client-side
- API keys and credentials stored securely in browser
- No transmission of proprietary or sensitive information to external services
- Compliance with organizational security policies and standards

children.title: 2.5 Assumptions and Dependencies
children.description:
System Assumptions:

Technical Assumptions:
- Modern web browsers will continue to support required JavaScript features
- Local storage will remain available and reliable for data persistence
- External AI services will maintain stable APIs and reasonable response times
- GitHub API will continue to provide required functionality for version control integration

User Assumptions:
- Users have basic familiarity with web applications and project management concepts
- Users will provide necessary API keys and configuration for external services
- Users will follow recommended backup and data management practices
- Users have appropriate permissions for version control and external service access

Operational Assumptions:
- Internet connectivity will be available for AI and version control features
- External services will maintain acceptable uptime and performance
- Regulatory requirements will remain stable during development and deployment
- Organizational policies will support the use of AI-powered tools

System Dependencies:

External Service Dependencies:
- Google Gemini API for AI-powered content generation and analysis
- GitHub API for version control integration and repository management
- Modern web browser engines for application execution
- Internet connectivity for external service communication

Technology Dependencies:
- React 18+ framework for user interface development
- TypeScript for type-safe development and enhanced maintainability
- Vite build system for development and production builds
- Local storage APIs for client-side data persistence

Standards Dependencies:
- CMMI framework for process maturity assessment
- IEEE 830 standard for requirements specification structure
- Compliance frameworks (ISO 27001, SOC 2, HIPAA, FDA CFR) for validation
- Federal Rules of Evidence for audit trail requirements

children.title: 3.5 CSCI Internal Data Requirements
children.description:
Internal Data Management Requirements:

REQ-DATA-001: Data Model Requirements
- Standardized data schemas for all project artifacts (requirements, test cases, documents)
- Type-safe data structures using TypeScript interfaces
- Data validation and sanitization at all input points
- Consistent data transformation and serialization formats

REQ-DATA-002: Local Storage Requirements
- Browser localStorage for primary data persistence
- Automatic data backup and recovery mechanisms
- Data compression for storage optimization
- Cross-browser storage compatibility and migration

REQ-DATA-003: Data Integrity Requirements
- Data validation rules and constraint checking
- Referential integrity for linked data (requirements to test cases)
- Data versioning and change tracking
- Automated data corruption detection and recovery

REQ-DATA-004: Data Security Requirements
- Client-side encryption for sensitive data
- Secure API key storage and management
- Data anonymization for external service communication
- Audit trail data protection and integrity verification

children.title: 3.6 Adaptation Requirements
children.description:
System Adaptation and Customization Requirements:

REQ-ADAPT-001: Configuration Customization
- User-configurable quality gate thresholds and validation rules
- Customizable compliance framework selection and configuration
- Adaptable workflow processes and automation settings
- Configurable dashboard layouts and visualization preferences

REQ-ADAPT-002: Organizational Adaptation
- Support for multiple organizational process frameworks
- Customizable document templates and structures
- Adaptable role-based access and permission models
- Configurable audit and reporting requirements

REQ-ADAPT-003: Deployment Adaptation
- Multiple deployment environment support (cloud, on-premises, hybrid)
- Configurable external service integrations
- Adaptable security and compliance configurations
- Scalable architecture for different organizational sizes

REQ-ADAPT-004: Process Adaptation
- Configurable development lifecycle models
- Adaptable quality assurance processes and procedures
- Customizable configuration management workflows
- Flexible reporting and analytics configurations

children.title: 3.7 Safety Requirements
children.description:
System Safety and Risk Mitigation Requirements:

REQ-SAFETY-001: Data Safety Requirements
- Automatic data backup before critical operations
- Data recovery mechanisms for system failures
- Protection against data loss during browser crashes
- Safe data migration and upgrade procedures

REQ-SAFETY-002: Operational Safety Requirements
- Graceful degradation when external services are unavailable
- Safe error handling and recovery procedures
- Protection against infinite loops and resource exhaustion
- Safe concurrent operation handling

REQ-SAFETY-003: User Safety Requirements
- Clear warnings before destructive operations
- Confirmation dialogs for critical actions
- Undo/redo capabilities for user actions
- Protection against accidental data modification

REQ-SAFETY-004: System Safety Requirements
- Safe handling of malformed or corrupted data
- Protection against memory leaks and performance degradation
- Safe integration with external APIs and services
- Automated system health monitoring and alerts

children.title: 3.8 Security and Privacy Requirements
children.description:
Security and Privacy Protection Requirements:

REQ-SEC-001: Data Security Requirements
- All sensitive data stored locally (no server-side transmission)
- Secure API key storage using browser security mechanisms
- Encryption of sensitive data at rest in local storage
- Secure communication protocols (HTTPS) for external services

REQ-SEC-002: Privacy Requirements
- No transmission of proprietary or sensitive information to external services
- User consent for all external service communications
- Data anonymization for AI service interactions
- Compliance with GDPR, HIPAA, and other privacy regulations

REQ-SEC-003: Access Control Requirements
- Secure authentication for external service access
- Role-based access control for enterprise deployments
- Session management and timeout controls
- Audit logging for all security-relevant operations

REQ-SEC-004: Compliance Security Requirements
- Federal Rules of Evidence 901/902 compliant audit trails
- Digital signature support for document authentication
- Hash verification for data integrity
- Chain of custody maintenance for audit evidence

content.title: 4. Qualification Provisions
content.description: This section defines the qualification methods to be used to ensure that each requirement in Section 3 has been met. The methods include demonstration, test, analysis, inspection, and special qualification methods as appropriate for each requirement.

children.title: 4.1 Qualification Methods Overview
children.description:
Qualification Methods for CSCI Requirements:

The following qualification methods shall be used to verify and validate that each requirement specified in Section 3 has been properly implemented and meets the specified criteria:

a. Demonstration: Observable functional operation of the CSCI or components without requiring special instrumentation or subsequent analysis
b. Test: Operation using instrumentation or special test equipment to collect data for analysis
c. Analysis: Processing of accumulated data from other qualification methods through reduction, interpretation, or extrapolation
d. Inspection: Visual examination of CSCI code, documentation, and artifacts
e. Special Qualification Methods: Specialized tools, techniques, procedures, and facilities with defined acceptance limits

Qualification Approach:
- Each requirement shall be mapped to one or more qualification methods
- Qualification methods shall be appropriate for the requirement type and criticality
- Test procedures shall be documented and repeatable
- Acceptance criteria shall be clearly defined and measurable
- Qualification results shall be documented and traceable to requirements

children.title: 4.2 Functional Requirements Qualification
children.description:
Qualification Methods for Functional Requirements:

REQ-FUNC-001 through REQ-FUNC-020 (Document Management Functions):
- Primary Method: Demonstration
- Secondary Method: Test
- Acceptance Criteria: User can successfully create, edit, save, and manage project documents
- Test Environment: Web browser with local storage enabled
- Special Tools: Browser developer tools for storage verification

REQ-FUNC-021 through REQ-FUNC-040 (Requirements Management Functions):
- Primary Method: Test
- Secondary Method: Analysis
- Acceptance Criteria: Requirements can be captured, validated, and traced with 100% accuracy
- Test Environment: Complete project scenario with multiple requirements
- Special Tools: Automated traceability validation scripts

REQ-FUNC-041 through REQ-FUNC-060 (Configuration Management Functions):
- Primary Method: Test
- Secondary Method: Inspection
- Acceptance Criteria: Configuration items are properly identified, controlled, and audited
- Test Environment: Version control integration with GitHub
- Special Tools: Git analysis tools and configuration audit scripts

REQ-FUNC-061 through REQ-FUNC-080 (Quality Assurance Functions):
- Primary Method: Analysis
- Secondary Method: Test
- Acceptance Criteria: Quality gates function correctly with configurable thresholds
- Test Environment: Projects with varying quality levels
- Special Tools: Quality metrics analysis and reporting tools

children.title: 4.3 Non-Functional Requirements Qualification
children.description:
Qualification Methods for Non-Functional Requirements:

Performance Requirements (REQ-PERF-001 through REQ-PERF-010):
- Primary Method: Test
- Secondary Method: Analysis
- Acceptance Criteria: Application loads in under 3 seconds, operations complete within specified time limits
- Test Environment: Various browser configurations and network conditions
- Special Tools: Performance monitoring tools, network throttling, browser profiling

Security Requirements (REQ-SEC-001 through REQ-SEC-020):
- Primary Method: Inspection
- Secondary Method: Test
- Acceptance Criteria: No sensitive data transmitted externally, secure storage implementation
- Test Environment: Security testing environment with network monitoring
- Special Tools: Security scanning tools, network traffic analysis, penetration testing

Usability Requirements (REQ-UI-001 through REQ-UI-010):
- Primary Method: Demonstration
- Secondary Method: Test
- Acceptance Criteria: User interface meets accessibility standards and usability guidelines
- Test Environment: Multiple browsers, devices, and accessibility tools
- Special Tools: Accessibility testing tools, screen readers, usability testing frameworks

Reliability Requirements (REQ-REL-001 through REQ-REL-010):
- Primary Method: Test
- Secondary Method: Analysis
- Acceptance Criteria: System operates reliably under normal and stress conditions
- Test Environment: Extended operation scenarios with error injection
- Special Tools: Reliability testing frameworks, error injection tools, monitoring systems

children.title: 4.4 Interface Requirements Qualification
children.description:
Qualification Methods for Interface Requirements:

External API Interface Requirements (REQ-API-001 through REQ-API-010):
- Primary Method: Test
- Secondary Method: Analysis
- Acceptance Criteria: All external API integrations function correctly with proper error handling
- Test Environment: Live API connections with various response scenarios
- Special Tools: API testing tools, mock services, network simulation

User Interface Requirements (REQ-UI-001 through REQ-UI-020):
- Primary Method: Demonstration
- Secondary Method: Inspection
- Acceptance Criteria: User interface meets design specifications and user experience requirements
- Test Environment: Multiple browsers, screen sizes, and user scenarios
- Special Tools: UI testing frameworks, cross-browser testing tools, design validation tools

Data Interface Requirements (REQ-DATA-001 through REQ-DATA-010):
- Primary Method: Test
- Secondary Method: Inspection
- Acceptance Criteria: Data formats, validation, and transformation work correctly
- Test Environment: Various data scenarios including edge cases and error conditions
- Special Tools: Data validation tools, schema verification, format testing utilities

System Interface Requirements (REQ-SYS-001 through REQ-SYS-010):
- Primary Method: Test
- Secondary Method: Analysis
- Acceptance Criteria: System integrations operate within specified parameters
- Test Environment: Integrated system environment with all external dependencies
- Special Tools: Integration testing frameworks, system monitoring, dependency analysis

children.title: 4.5 Compliance Requirements Qualification
children.description:
Qualification Methods for Compliance Requirements:

Regulatory Compliance Requirements (REQ-COMP-001 through REQ-COMP-020):
- Primary Method: Inspection
- Secondary Method: Analysis
- Acceptance Criteria: System meets all specified regulatory requirements (HIPAA, SOC 2, ISO 27001, FDA CFR)
- Test Environment: Compliance validation environment with audit trail verification
- Special Tools: Compliance scanning tools, audit trail analyzers, regulatory validation frameworks

Federal Rules of Evidence Requirements (REQ-FRE-001 through REQ-FRE-010):
- Primary Method: Inspection
- Secondary Method: Test
- Acceptance Criteria: Audit trails meet FRE 901/902 authentication and self-authentication standards
- Test Environment: Legal compliance testing environment with chain of custody verification
- Special Tools: Digital signature verification, hash validation, chain of custody tracking

CMMI Process Requirements (REQ-CMMI-001 through REQ-CMMI-020):
- Primary Method: Analysis
- Secondary Method: Inspection
- Acceptance Criteria: System supports CMMI process areas and maturity level assessment
- Test Environment: CMMI assessment environment with process validation
- Special Tools: CMMI assessment tools, process maturity analyzers, gap analysis utilities

Quality Standards Requirements (REQ-QUAL-001 through REQ-QUAL-010):
- Primary Method: Test
- Secondary Method: Analysis
- Acceptance Criteria: System meets specified quality standards and metrics
- Test Environment: Quality validation environment with metrics collection
- Special Tools: Quality metrics tools, standards compliance checkers, quality gate validation

children.title: 4.6 Special Qualification Methods
children.description:
Special Qualification Methods and Tools:

AI-Powered Validation:
- Method: Automated AI-powered content analysis and validation
- Tools: Google Gemini API integration for content quality assessment
- Procedures: Automated content generation validation, quality scoring, improvement suggestions
- Acceptance Limits: AI-generated content must meet quality thresholds and human review standards
- Facilities: AI service integration testing environment

Meta-Compliance Validation:
- Method: Self-validation using the system to manage its own development process
- Tools: Ignition system itself for process validation and compliance checking
- Procedures: System manages its own requirements, documents, and compliance validation
- Acceptance Limits: System must successfully manage its own development with full traceability
- Facilities: Production environment running the system for self-management

Continuous Integration Validation:
- Method: Automated build, test, and deployment validation
- Tools: GitHub Actions, automated testing frameworks, deployment validation
- Procedures: Automated quality gates, continuous compliance checking, deployment verification
- Acceptance Limits: All automated checks must pass with zero critical issues
- Facilities: CI/CD pipeline with automated quality and compliance validation

Real-Time Process Validation:
- Method: Live process monitoring and validation during system operation
- Tools: Real-time analytics, process monitoring, compliance dashboards
- Procedures: Continuous process assessment, real-time compliance monitoring, automated alerts
- Acceptance Limits: Process compliance must maintain specified thresholds during operation
- Facilities: Production monitoring environment with real-time analytics and alerting

content.title: 6. Notes
content.description: This section contains general information that aids in understanding this document, including background information, glossary, rationale, acronyms, abbreviations, and terms definitions.

children.title: 6.1 Background Information
children.description:
Background Information and Rationale:

Project Genesis:
The Ignition AI Project Dashboard was conceived to address the growing complexity of software development compliance requirements across multiple regulatory frameworks. Traditional project management tools lack the sophisticated compliance validation and process automation capabilities required for modern software development organizations operating in regulated industries.

Technological Approach:
The system leverages cutting-edge AI technology to provide intelligent assistance while maintaining strict data privacy and security requirements. The client-side architecture ensures that sensitive organizational data never leaves the user's environment, addressing critical security and compliance concerns.

Meta-Compliance Philosophy:
A unique aspect of this system is its "meta-compliance" approach, where the tool manages its own development process using the same compliance frameworks it provides to users. This creates a self-validating system that demonstrates its effectiveness through its own successful development and deployment.

Industry Context:
The software development industry increasingly requires compliance with multiple standards simultaneously (ISO 27001, SOC 2, HIPAA, FDA CFR Part 11, CMMI). Traditional approaches require separate tools and processes for each standard, creating complexity and inefficiency. Ignition provides unified compliance management across all these frameworks.

Innovation Areas:
- AI-powered process asset generation and improvement
- Real-time compliance validation and gap analysis
- Automated requirements traceability and impact analysis
- Self-managing development processes with continuous improvement
- Hybrid wiki and structured data management for organizational knowledge

Future Vision:
The system is designed to evolve into an organizational intelligence platform that not only manages compliance but actively improves development processes through machine learning and continuous optimization.

children.title: 6.3 Glossary of Terms
children.description:
Definitions of Terms Used in This Document:

Audit Trail: A chronological record of system activities that provides documentary evidence of the sequence of activities that have affected a specific operation, procedure, or event.

Baseline: A formally approved version of a configuration item, regardless of media, formally designated and fixed at a specific time during the configuration item's life cycle.

Computer Software Configuration Item (CSCI): An aggregation of software that satisfies an end use function and is designated for configuration management.

Configuration Management: A discipline applying technical and administrative direction and surveillance to identify and document the functional and physical characteristics of a configuration item.

Meta-Compliance: The practice of using a compliance management system to manage its own development process, creating a self-validating and self-improving system.

Process Asset: Any artifact, template, guideline, or other work product that can be used to define, implement, or improve a process.

Qualification: The process of demonstrating whether an entity is capable of fulfilling specified requirements.

Requirement: A condition or capability that must be met or possessed by a system or system component to satisfy a contract, standard, specification, or other formally imposed document.

Traceability: The degree to which a relationship can be established between two or more products of the development process, especially products having a predecessor-successor or master-subordinate relationship to one another.

Validation: Confirmation, through the provision of objective evidence, that the requirements for a specific intended use or application have been fulfilled.

Verification: Confirmation, through the provision of objective evidence, that specified requirements have been fulfilled.

Work Product: Any artifact produced by a process, including documents, code, models, plans, or other deliverables.

children.title: 6.4 Document Rationale and Design Decisions
children.description:
Document Rationale and Key Design Decisions:

Architectural Decisions:

Client-Side Architecture: The decision to implement a client-side only architecture was driven by security and privacy requirements. This ensures that sensitive organizational data never leaves the user's environment, addressing critical compliance concerns for regulated industries.

AI Integration Approach: The integration with Google Gemini API was chosen to provide advanced AI capabilities while maintaining data privacy. Only non-sensitive, anonymized data is sent to external AI services for processing.

Local Storage Strategy: Browser local storage was selected over server-side databases to maintain data privacy and reduce infrastructure complexity. This approach supports the client-side architecture while providing adequate data persistence for typical use cases.

Compliance Framework Selection:
The system supports multiple compliance frameworks (ISO 27001, SOC 2, HIPAA, FDA CFR Part 11, CMMI) based on industry analysis showing that organizations typically need to comply with multiple standards simultaneously.

Process Design Decisions:

Meta-Compliance Implementation: The decision to use the system to manage its own development process provides both validation of the system's capabilities and continuous improvement through real-world usage.

Real-Time Validation: Continuous validation and quality assessment were implemented to provide immediate feedback and prevent compliance drift during development.

AI-Powered Automation: Automated content generation and improvement features were included to reduce manual effort while maintaining quality and compliance standards.

Technology Stack Rationale:

React Framework: Selected for its mature ecosystem, strong TypeScript support, and excellent performance characteristics for complex user interfaces.

TypeScript: Chosen to provide type safety and enhanced maintainability for a complex system with multiple data models and interfaces.

Vite Build System: Selected for its fast development experience and optimized production builds suitable for client-side deployment.

content.title: 1. Scope
content.description: This section defines the scope of the Interface Requirements Specification for the Ignition AI Project Dashboard system in accordance with DI-IPSC-81434A.

children.title: 1.1 Identification
children.description:
System and Interface Identification:

System Name: Ignition AI Project Dashboard
System Identification: IGN-SYS-001
Version: 1.0
Release: Initial Release

Interface Coverage:
This Interface Requirements Specification covers all external interfaces required for the Ignition AI Project Dashboard Computer Software Configuration Item (CSCI) to interact with:

- External AI Services (Google Gemini API)
- Version Control Systems (GitHub API)
- Web Browser Environment (Browser APIs)
- Local Storage Systems (Browser Storage APIs)
- File System Interfaces (Import/Export)
- Network Communication Interfaces
- User Interface Systems
- Operating System Interfaces

Interface Identification Numbers:
- INT-001 through INT-010: External Service Interfaces
- INT-011 through INT-020: Browser Environment Interfaces
- INT-021 through INT-030: Data Storage Interfaces
- INT-031 through INT-040: User Interface Interfaces
- INT-041 through INT-050: System Integration Interfaces

children.title: 1.2 System Overview
children.description:
System Purpose and Interface Context:

The Ignition AI Project Dashboard is a client-side web application that requires multiple external interfaces to provide comprehensive project management and compliance validation capabilities.

Interface Architecture:
- Client-Server Interfaces: RESTful API communications with external services
- Browser Integration: Native browser API utilization for local operations
- Data Interfaces: JSON-based data exchange and local storage management
- User Interfaces: Modern web-based responsive interface design
- Security Interfaces: Secure authentication and data protection mechanisms

Interface Dependencies:
- Google Gemini API for AI-powered content generation and analysis
- GitHub API for version control integration and repository management
- Modern web browser APIs for application execution and data persistence
- Local file system access for import/export operations
- Network connectivity for external service communication

Interface Constraints:
- All sensitive data must remain client-side (no server-side transmission)
- External API communications must use secure protocols (HTTPS)
- Browser compatibility requirements across multiple platforms
- Rate limiting and quota management for external services
- Offline capability for core functionality when external services unavailable

children.title: 1.3 Document Overview
children.description:
Document Purpose and Security Considerations:

This Interface Requirements Specification defines the complete set of interface requirements for the Ignition AI Project Dashboard system. It serves as the authoritative source for all external interface specifications and requirements.

Document Contents:
- Section 1: Scope and system identification
- Section 2: Referenced documents and standards
- Section 3: Detailed interface requirements and specifications
- Section 4: Qualification provisions and testing methods
- Section 5: Requirements traceability and verification

Security and Privacy Considerations:
- All interface specifications include security requirements and constraints
- Privacy protection measures for data transmitted through interfaces
- Authentication and authorization requirements for external service access
- Data encryption and secure communication protocol requirements
- Audit trail requirements for interface operations and transactions

Interface Documentation Standards:
- All interfaces documented with complete technical specifications
- Interface diagrams and data flow documentation included
- Error handling and exception management specifications
- Performance requirements and constraints for each interface
- Compliance requirements for regulatory and industry standards

children.title: 3.1 Interface Identification and Diagrams

INT-002: GitHub API Interface
- Interface Type: RESTful API over HTTPS
- Interfacing Entities: Ignition CSCI Ã¢ÂÂ GitHub Service
- Protocol: HTTPS/1.1, JSON payload

- Data Flow: Bidirectional (request/response)

INT-003: Browser Storage Interface
- Interface Type: Web API (localStorage, sessionStorage)
- Interfacing Entities: Ignition CSCI Ã¢ÂÂ Browser Storage

- Data Flow: Bidirectional (read/write)

INT-004: File System Interface
- Interface Type: Web File API

[Ignition CSCI]

[External Services]

Developing Interface Characteristics:
- Custom data schemas for project data exchange

children.title: 3.2 Google Gemini API Interface (INT-001)
children.description:
Google Gemini API Interface Requirements:

IRS-REQ-001: API Connection Management
The system shall establish and maintain secure HTTPS connections to the Google Gemini API endpoint (https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com).
Qualification Method: Test
Traceability: SRS-REQ-AI-001

IRS-REQ-002: Authentication and Authorization
The system shall authenticate with the Google Gemini API using API key-based authentication provided by the user.
Qualification Method: Test, Inspection
Traceability: SRS-REQ-SEC-001

IRS-REQ-003: Request Format and Structure
The system shall format API requests according to the Gemini API specification with proper JSON structure, model selection, and content parameters.
Qualification Method: Test, Analysis
Traceability: SRS-REQ-AI-002

IRS-REQ-004: Response Processing
The system shall process API responses including success responses, error responses, and streaming responses according to the API specification.
Qualification Method: Test
Traceability: SRS-REQ-AI-003

IRS-REQ-005: Error Handling and Recovery
The system shall implement comprehensive error handling for API failures, rate limiting, quota exceeded, and network connectivity issues.
Qualification Method: Test
Traceability: SRS-REQ-REL-001

IRS-REQ-006: Data Privacy and Security
The system shall ensure that no sensitive or proprietary data is transmitted to the Gemini API, implementing data anonymization and filtering.
Qualification Method: Inspection, Test
Traceability: SRS-REQ-SEC-002

Interface Data Elements:
- Request: model, contents, generationConfig, safetySettings
- Response: candidates, promptFeedback, usageMetadata
- Error: error code, message, details

Performance Requirements:
- Response time: < 30 seconds for standard requests
- Timeout handling: 60 seconds maximum
- Rate limiting: Respect API quotas and limits

children.title: 3.3 GitHub API Interface (INT-002)
children.description:
GitHub API Interface Requirements:

IRS-REQ-007: GitHub API Connection
The system shall establish secure HTTPS connections to the GitHub REST API (https://api.github.com) and GraphQL API (https://api.github.com/graphql).
Qualification Method: Test
Traceability: SRS-REQ-VCS-001

IRS-REQ-008: OAuth 2.0 Authentication
The system shall support OAuth 2.0 authentication flow and Personal Access Token authentication for GitHub API access.
Qualification Method: Test, Demonstration
Traceability: SRS-REQ-SEC-003

IRS-REQ-009: Repository Operations
The system shall support repository operations including repository listing, file access, commit history, and branch management through the GitHub API.
Qualification Method: Test
Traceability: SRS-REQ-VCS-002

IRS-REQ-010: Issue and Pull Request Management
The system shall interface with GitHub Issues and Pull Requests APIs for project management integration.
Qualification Method: Test
Traceability: SRS-REQ-VCS-003

IRS-REQ-011: Webhook Integration
The system shall support GitHub webhook integration for real-time repository event notifications.
Qualification Method: Test
Traceability: SRS-REQ-VCS-004

IRS-REQ-012: Rate Limiting Compliance
The system shall implement rate limiting compliance according to GitHub API limits and provide appropriate user feedback.
Qualification Method: Test, Analysis
Traceability: SRS-REQ-REL-002

Interface Data Elements:
- Authentication: token, scope, permissions
- Repository: name, owner, url, default_branch
- Commit: sha, message, author, timestamp
- Issue: number, title, body, state, labels
- Pull Request: number, title, head, base, state

API Endpoints:
- REST API: /repos, /issues, /pulls, /commits
- GraphQL API: Single endpoint with query flexibility
- Webhooks: Configurable event notifications

children.title: 3.4 Browser Storage Interface (INT-003)
children.description:
Browser Storage Interface Requirements:

IRS-REQ-013: Local Storage Management
The system shall utilize browser localStorage API for persistent data storage with proper error handling and quota management.
Qualification Method: Test
Traceability: SRS-REQ-DATA-001

IRS-REQ-014: Session Storage Utilization
The system shall use sessionStorage for temporary data that should not persist across browser sessions.
Qualification Method: Test
Traceability: SRS-REQ-DATA-002

IRS-REQ-015: Data Serialization and Deserialization
The system shall implement robust JSON serialization/deserialization with error handling for corrupted data.
Qualification Method: Test, Analysis
Traceability: SRS-REQ-DATA-003

IRS-REQ-016: Storage Quota Management
The system shall monitor storage usage and provide user notifications when approaching browser storage limits.
Qualification Method: Test
Traceability: SRS-REQ-DATA-004

IRS-REQ-017: Data Backup and Recovery
The system shall implement automatic data backup mechanisms and recovery procedures for storage failures.
Qualification Method: Test
Traceability: SRS-REQ-REL-003

IRS-REQ-018: Cross-Browser Compatibility
The system shall ensure storage interface compatibility across supported browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge).
Qualification Method: Test
Traceability: SRS-REQ-COMP-001

Storage Data Structure:
- Project Data: JSON objects with schema validation
- User Preferences: Configuration settings and UI state
- Cache Data: Temporary data for performance optimization
- Audit Logs: Compliance and tracking information

Storage Operations:
- setItem(): Store data with error handling
- getItem(): Retrieve data with validation
- removeItem(): Delete specific data items
- clear(): Complete storage cleanup
- Storage events: Cross-tab synchronization

Analysis:
- API response data validation and schema compliance

- Compliance analysis against interface standards

Inspection:

- Configuration review for security and performance
- Standards compliance verification

Special Qualification Methods:
- Live API integration testing with external services
- Cross-platform browser testing automation
- Real-time monitoring and alerting systems
- Automated security scanning and vulnerability assessment

Acceptance Criteria:
- All interface requirements must pass qualification testing
- Performance requirements must be met under specified conditions
- Security requirements must be verified through testing and inspection
- Compatibility requirements must be demonstrated across target platforms

content.title: 1. Scope
content.description: This section defines the scope of the Software Test Plan for the Ignition AI Project Dashboard Computer Software Configuration Item (CSCI) in accordance with DI-IPSC-81438A.

children.title: 1.1 Identification
children.description:
System and Software Identification:

System Name: Ignition AI Project Dashboard
CSCI Name: Ignition AI Project Dashboard CSCI
CSCI Identification: IGN-CSCI-001
Version: 1.0
Release: Initial Release
Abbreviation: Ignition

Test Plan Identification:
Test Plan ID: STP-IGN-001
Test Plan Version: 1.0
Approval Date: Current
Test Plan Type: CSCI Qualification Testing

Applicable Documents:
- Software Development Plan (SDP): DI-IPSC-81427B
- Software Requirements Specification (SRS): DI-IPSC-81433A
- Interface Requirements Specification (IRS): DI-IPSC-81434A
- Configuration Management Plan
- Quality Assurance Procedures

Test Coverage:
This Software Test Plan covers qualification testing for all functional and non-functional requirements specified in the SRS, including:
- Functional requirements testing
- Performance requirements verification
- Security requirements validation
- Interface requirements testing
- Compliance requirements verification
- User acceptance testing
- System integration testing

children.title: 1.2 System Overview
children.description:
System Purpose and Testing Context:

The Ignition AI Project Dashboard is a client-side web application that provides comprehensive project management, compliance validation, and process optimization capabilities. This test plan addresses the unique testing challenges of a client-side application with AI integration.

Testing Scope:
- Client-side application functionality testing
- AI service integration testing with external APIs
- Browser compatibility and performance testing
- Data persistence and recovery testing
- Security and privacy compliance testing
- Multi-standard compliance validation testing

Testing Approach:
- Automated unit testing for core functionality
- Integration testing for external service interfaces
- End-to-end testing for complete user workflows
- Performance testing under various load conditions
- Security testing for data protection and privacy
- Compliance testing against multiple regulatory frameworks

Testing Environment:
- Development Environment: Local development with mock services
- Integration Environment: Live external service integration
- Staging Environment: Production-like environment for final validation
- Production Environment: Live system monitoring and validation

Testing Constraints:
- Client-side only architecture limits server-side testing
- External API dependencies require careful test data management
- Browser compatibility testing across multiple platforms
- Privacy requirements limit data collection for testing

children.title: 1.3 Document Overview
children.description:
Test Plan Purpose and Security Considerations:

This Software Test Plan provides comprehensive testing procedures and schedules for qualification testing of the Ignition AI Project Dashboard CSCI. It serves as the authoritative guide for all testing activities and quality assurance procedures.

Document Contents:
- Section 1: Scope and system identification
- Section 2: Referenced documents and standards
- Section 3: Software test environment specifications
- Section 4: Test identification and detailed test procedures
- Section 5: Test schedules and timeline
- Section 6: Requirements traceability matrix
- Section 7: Notes, glossary, and appendices

Security and Privacy Considerations:
- All test data must comply with privacy and security requirements
- No sensitive or proprietary data used in testing external services
- Test environments must maintain security controls equivalent to production
- Test results and logs must be protected according to data classification
- Access to test environments restricted to authorized personnel only

Quality Assurance Integration:
- Test plan integrated with overall quality assurance procedures
- Automated quality gates and continuous testing implementation
- Real-time test result monitoring and reporting
- Compliance validation integrated into all testing phases
- Risk-based testing approach for critical functionality

content.title: 2. Referenced Documents
content.description: This section lists all documents referenced in this Software Test Plan, including standards, specifications, and testing documentation.

children.description:

content.title: 3. Software Test Environment
content.description: This section describes the software test environment at each intended test site, including hardware, software, and network configurations required for testing.

children.title: 3.1 Test Environment Configuration
children.description:
Test Environment Specifications:

Development Test Environment:
- Hardware: Developer workstations (Windows 10+, macOS 12+, Ubuntu 20.04+)
- Software: Node.js 18+, Modern browsers (Chrome 120+, Firefox 120+, Safari 17+, Edge 120+)
- Network: Local network with internet access for external API testing
- Test Framework: Vitest, React Testing Library, Playwright
- Mock Services: Local mock servers for external API simulation

Integration Test Environment:
- Hardware: Cloud-based virtual machines (2 vCPU, 4GB RAM minimum)
- Software: Production-equivalent browser environments
- Network: Secure internet connectivity with API access
- Test Data: Anonymized datasets and synthetic test data
- External Services: Live API connections with test credentials

Staging Test Environment:
- Hardware: Production-equivalent cloud infrastructure
- Software: Identical to production software stack
- Network: Production-like network configuration with security controls
- Test Data: Production-like datasets (fully anonymized)
- Monitoring: Full application performance monitoring and logging

Cross-Browser Test Environment:
- Hardware: Automated testing infrastructure (BrowserStack/Sauce Labs)
- Software: Multiple browser versions across different operating systems
- Network: Standardized network conditions for consistent testing
- Test Automation: Selenium WebDriver, Playwright automation
- Coverage: Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge across Windows, macOS, Linux

content.title: 4. Test Identification
content.description: This section identifies and describes each test to be performed as part of the qualification testing for the Ignition AI Project Dashboard CSCI.

children.title: 4.1 General Information
children.description:
General Testing Information:

4.1.1 Test Levels:
Testing will be performed at the following levels:
- Unit Level: Individual component and function testing
- Integration Level: Component integration and API integration testing
- System Level: Complete system functionality testing
- Acceptance Level: User acceptance and compliance validation testing

4.1.2 Test Classes:
The following types of tests will be performed:
- Functional Tests: Core application functionality verification
- Performance Tests: Load, stress, and response time testing
- Security Tests: Authentication, authorization, and data protection testing
- Compatibility Tests: Cross-browser and cross-platform testing
- Usability Tests: User interface and user experience validation
- Compliance Tests: Regulatory and standards compliance verification
- Integration Tests: External API and service integration testing
- Regression Tests: Verification of existing functionality after changes

4.1.3 Test Approach:
- Risk-based testing prioritizing critical functionality
- Automated testing for regression and performance testing
- Manual testing for usability and exploratory testing
- Continuous testing integrated with development workflow
- Test-driven development for new functionality
- Behavior-driven development using Gherkin specifications

content.title: 5. Test Schedules
content.description: This section contains the schedules for conducting the tests identified in this plan, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation.

children.title: 5.1 Testing Timeline and Milestones
children.description:
Test Schedule Overview:

Phase 1: Unit and Component Testing (Weeks 1-2)
- Unit test development and execution
- Component integration testing
- Code coverage analysis and reporting
- Initial performance baseline establishment

Phase 2: Integration Testing (Weeks 3-4)
- External API integration testing
- Browser compatibility testing
- Security and privacy testing
- Data persistence and recovery testing

Phase 3: System Testing (Weeks 5-6)
- End-to-end functionality testing
- Performance and load testing
- Compliance validation testing
- User acceptance testing preparation

Phase 4: Acceptance Testing (Weeks 7-8)
- User acceptance testing execution
- Compliance certification testing
- Production readiness validation
- Final test report preparation

Continuous Activities:
- Automated regression testing (ongoing)
- Performance monitoring (ongoing)
- Security scanning (weekly)
- Compliance monitoring (ongoing)

Test Site Schedule:
- Development Environment: Continuous testing during development
- Integration Environment: Daily integration testing
- Staging Environment: Weekly comprehensive testing
- Production Environment: Continuous monitoring and smoke testing
